decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Amped Raptor, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal damage to the opponent swiftly. The deck also includes powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage and control. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds versatility and threat to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and direct damage spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing UrzaTron lands to ramp up quickly and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and World Breaker. It also has a control aspect with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's board with All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command, while generating card advantage with Ugin's Labyrinth and Sowing Mycospawn. The inclusion of cards like Talisman of Resilience and Boseiju, Who Endures adds resilience to the deck, making it difficult for the opponent to deal with its threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard and generate a powerful combo. The deck includes cards that can untap lands and generate mana, allowing for explosive turns where multiple spells can be cast in a single turn. The goal is to use these combo pieces to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory. The deck also includes cards for card draw and manipulation to help find the key combo pieces needed for the win.

The main theme of the deck is utilizing aggressive creatures and removal spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With a combination of powerful creatures like Amped Raptor, Orcish Bowmasters, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, alongside removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Fatal Push, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game. The inclusion of companions like Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an additional layer of strategy to the deck, making it versatile and adaptable to different matchups.

This deck aims to use powerful mana acceleration cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals to quickly generate a large amount of red mana. Combined with efficient card draw and graveyard recursion through Past in Flames, the deck can cast multiple spells in a single turn to deal a large amount of damage. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Reckless Impulse provide additional card advantage and damage output. The goal is to assemble a critical mass of spells to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to stall the game until it can establish a powerful board presence with creatures like Crackling Drake and Thundertrap Trainer while keeping the opponent's threats at bay. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and secure the win through card advantage and strategic plays.

This aggressive Mardu Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and removal spells to overwhelm opponents quickly. By including Jegantha as a companion, the deck gains additional consistency and flexibility. The deck features a mix of powerful creatures like Ajani's Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Galvanic Discharge. With a combination of speed, aggression, and disruption, this deck aims to outpace opponents and secure victory through a combination of creature damage and removal.

This deck focuses on assembling the Heliod + Spike Feeder combo to generate infinite life and create an infinitely large creature to win the game. It uses cards like Collected Company to assemble the pieces quickly and efficiently, while also running disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Solitude to interact with the opponent's board. The deck also includes mana ramp in the form of Noble Hierarch and ramp payoffs like Recruiters of the Guard to ensure it can consistently execute its game plan.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using various toolbox creatures and combo pieces to quickly assemble a winning board state. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact, the deck can find specific creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Suncleanser to control the game. With the ability to tutor for key pieces and protect them with protection spells, this deck aims to quickly and efficiently execute its game plan to achieve victory.
